column4: tote UK British EBF 'Confined' Maiden Stakes (Have Run No More Than Once) (GBB Race)
column19: Experience will count for a lot on slow ground and RIVER CARD posted a useful RPR for a debutant when second at Deauville.
column20: 5/4 River Card, 2/1 Study Of Words, 5/1 Maltese Cross, 9/1 Lost Boys, 12/1 Echo Of Stars
column36: 100,000euros yearling; lots to like on paper and the market can guide as to expectations
column37: 100,000euros yearling; seventh foal; brother to winners Alpen Rose (7f-1m; Group 3; RPR 107) and Sea Sylph (1m2f/1m6f; 93); dam 6f 2yo winner (96); lots to like on paper and the market should guide as to expectations.

column4: tote UK British EBF 'Confined' Maiden Stakes (Have Run No More Than Once) (GBB Race)

column20: 5/4 River Card, 2/1 Study Of Words, 5/1 Maltese Cross, 9/1 Lost Boys, 12/1 Echo Of Stars

column4: tote UK British EBF 'Confined' Maiden Stakes (Have Run No More Than Once) (GBB Race)
column19: Experience will count for a lot on slow ground and RIVER CARD posted a useful RPR for a debutant when second at Deauville.
column20: 5/4 River Card, 2/1 Study Of Words, 5/1 Maltese Cross, 9/1 Lost Boys, 12/1 Echo Of Stars
column36: Value rose from 200,000euros as a foal to 350,000gns as a yearling; in a top yard
column37: Value rose from 200,000euros as a foal to 350,000gns as a yearling; third foal; half-brother to French 1m4f winner Namouria (RPR 98); dam Belgian 1m6f winner, half-sister to German 1m4f Group 1 winners Nymphea and Nutan; has to be of interest.

column4: tote UK British EBF 'Confined' Maiden Stakes (Have Run No More Than Once) (GBB Race)

column20: 5/4 River Card, 2/1 Study Of Words, 5/1 Maltese Cross, 9/1 Lost Boys, 12/1 Echo Of Stars

column4: tote UK British EBF 'Confined' Maiden Stakes (Have Run No More Than Once) (GBB Race)
column19: Experience will count for a lot on slow ground and RIVER CARD posted a useful RPR for a debutant when second at Deauville.
column20: 5/4 River Card, 2/1 Study Of Words, 5/1 Maltese Cross, 9/1 Lost Boys, 12/1 Echo Of Stars
column36: Frankel colt who is a brother to a 1m Listed winner; dam was also of that class
column37: Frankel colt who is a brother to 1m winner Nano Nagle (German Listed; RPR 107); dam 1m winner (Listed; 102) and half-sister to winners Blown By Wind (UAE 1m Group 3) and Hadith (1m 2yo Listed); obvious contender for top connections.

column4: Silent Pool Gin 'Confined' Handicap (Have Won No More Than One Race)
column19: The grey area is soft ground but CROWN OF OAKS once held Group-race entries and it should be onwards and upwards after Ayr.
column20: 10/11 Crown Of Oaks, 9/2 Wave Rider, 5/1 Stem, 13/2 Asmen Warrior, 12/1 Hymnbook, 16/1 Seagolazo
column32: Two Plus Three Two Plus Four
column36: Good 2yo form but only run of note this year was his third at Newmarket (1m) in July
column37: Signed off last season with excellent runs in a valuable sales race at Doncaster and a nursery (on soft) at York; the only run of note this year was his third at Newmarket (1m, good to firm) in July; others preferred.

column4: Silent Pool Gin 'Confined' Handicap (Have Won No More Than One Race)
column19: The grey area is soft ground but CROWN OF OAKS once held Group-race entries and it should be onwards and upwards after Ayr.
column20: 10/11 Crown Of Oaks, 9/2 Wave Rider, 5/1 Stem, 13/2 Asmen Warrior, 12/1 Hymnbook, 16/1 Seagolazo
column36: Looked progressive prior to a troubled run at Goodwood; soft ground an unknown
column37: Made all in a maiden on his fourth start and very nearly followed up on handicap debut here, again over 1m on good to firm; strong in the finish that day and didn't get the chance to show what he could do upped to 1m2f at Glorious Goodwood; soft ground is a complete unknown but remains of interest.

column4: Silent Pool Gin 'Confined' Handicap (Have Won No More Than One Race)
column19: The grey area is soft ground but CROWN OF OAKS once held Group-race entries and it should be onwards and upwards after Ayr.
column20: 10/11 Crown Of Oaks, 9/2 Wave Rider, 5/1 Stem, 13/2 Asmen Warrior, 12/1 Hymnbook, 16/1 Seagolazo
column36: Consistent gelding; has a race in him off this mark and he's proven on soft ground
column37: Competitive in two handicaps since winning his maiden at Sandown (1m2f, good to firm) and his Hamilton conqueror last time was unexposed; has a race in him off this mark and he's proven on soft ground.

column4: Silent Pool Gin 'Confined' Handicap (Have Won No More Than One Race)
column19: The grey area is soft ground but CROWN OF OAKS once held Group-race entries and it should be onwards and upwards after Ayr.
column20: 10/11 Crown Of Oaks, 9/2 Wave Rider, 5/1 Stem, 13/2 Asmen Warrior, 12/1 Hymnbook, 16/1 Seagolazo
column36: Runner-up in both handicaps for current yard but this has the look of a better race
column37: Took six races to win for previous yard and that came in a weak novice at odds of 4-11; runner-up in two 1m2f fast-ground handicaps for James Owen but both were in a lower grade than this; cheekpieces worn for last three races are replaced by a visor; kept to good or quicker ground since debut on heavy (well beaten).

column4: Silent Pool Gin 'Confined' Handicap (Have Won No More Than One Race)
column19: The grey area is soft ground but CROWN OF OAKS once held Group-race entries and it should be onwards and upwards after Ayr.
column20: 10/11 Crown Of Oaks, 9/2 Wave Rider, 5/1 Stem, 13/2 Asmen Warrior, 12/1 Hymnbook, 16/1 Seagolazo
column36: Encouraging runs until France last time; not yet exposed, not by a long chalk
column37: Wide-margin winner on heavy at Newbury last season (7f novice); it was a good race in which he was third under a penalty at Doncaster (1m4f, good) and unlikely that he gave his true running when connections went pot-hunting in a valuable conditions race at Deauville three weeks ago; not yet exposed, not by a long chalk.

column4: Silent Pool Gin 'Confined' Handicap (Have Won No More Than One Race)
column19: The grey area is soft ground but CROWN OF OAKS once held Group-race entries and it should be onwards and upwards after Ayr.
column20: 10/11 Crown Of Oaks, 9/2 Wave Rider, 5/1 Stem, 13/2 Asmen Warrior, 12/1 Hymnbook, 16/1 Seagolazo
column36: Gelded prior to getting off the mark at Ayr and retains significant potential
column37: Had some fancy entries at the start of the season but those went west after suffering two defeats at odds-on; however, was gelded prior to getting off the mark on handicap debut at Ayr (1m2f, good; 6lb lower) and won that with a nice bit in hand; in the Cambridgeshire and retains significant potential; unraced on soft ground.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.
column20: 5/1 Native Warrior, 6/1 Akkadian Thunder, 8/1 Leadman, 9/1 Great Acclaim,  Strong Warrior, 12/1 Darkness,  Tarkhan,  Bobby Bennu, 14/1 King's Lynn,  Telemark, 16/1 Mister Bluebird, 20/1 Rhoscolyn,  Sterling Knight,  Afentiko, 25/1 Eldrickjones,  Mirabeau,  Array,  Sword, 33/1 Thunder Roar, 40/1 Nostrum
column36: High-class 2yo but hasn't got anything going in four runs for his current yard
column37: High-class 2yo for Sir Michael Stoute but hasn't got anything going in four runs for his current yard; tongue-tie added.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.
column20: 5/1 Native Warrior, 6/1 Akkadian Thunder, 8/1 Leadman, 9/1 Great Acclaim,  Strong Warrior, 12/1 Darkness,  Tarkhan,  Bobby Bennu, 14/1 King's Lynn,  Telemark, 16/1 Mister Bluebird, 20/1 Rhoscolyn,  Sterling Knight,  Afentiko, 25/1 Eldrickjones,  Mirabeau,  Array,  Sword, 33/1 Thunder Roar, 40/1 Nostrum
column36: Goodwood specialist; has only once been placed in 12 previous starts at Ascot
column37: Would have found the ground quick enough at his beloved Goodwood two weeks ago, having previously won the Golden Mile there on soft (regular in that race); however, has only once been placed in 12 previous starts at Ascot.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.
column20: 5/1 Native Warrior, 6/1 Akkadian Thunder, 8/1 Leadman, 9/1 Great Acclaim,  Strong Warrior, 12/1 Darkness,  Tarkhan,  Bobby Bennu, 14/1 King's Lynn,  Telemark, 16/1 Mister Bluebird, 20/1 Rhoscolyn,  Sterling Knight,  Afentiko, 25/1 Eldrickjones,  Mirabeau,  Array,  Sword, 33/1 Thunder Roar, 40/1 Nostrum
column36: Group 2-winning 2yo on deep ground; not entirely dismissed now tried in a visor
column37: Won the Group 2 Mill Reef on heavy as a juvenile but missed all of his 3yo campaign and has yet to convince that he's the same force this season, latterly finishing well behind in the International here; however, there's always a chance the first-time visor might trigger something and he'll go on the ground; wouldn't put a line through him.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.
column20: 5/1 Native Warrior, 6/1 Akkadian Thunder, 8/1 Leadman, 9/1 Great Acclaim,  Strong Warrior, 12/1 Darkness,  Tarkhan,  Bobby Bennu, 14/1 King's Lynn,  Telemark, 16/1 Mister Bluebird, 20/1 Rhoscolyn,  Sterling Knight,  Afentiko, 25/1 Eldrickjones,  Mirabeau,  Array,  Sword, 33/1 Thunder Roar, 40/1 Nostrum
column36: Good course form includes a second in this last year; getting back on slow ground a plus
column37: Runner-up on soft ground in this last year and could easily have won; 6lb higher this time but confirmed his liking for this track when second to handicap blot Never So Brave in the 7f Buckingham Palace (good to firm); two lesser runs have followed but no surprise if getting back on slow ground floats his boat; respected.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.
column20: 5/1 Native Warrior, 6/1 Akkadian Thunder, 8/1 Leadman, 9/1 Great Acclaim,  Strong Warrior, 12/1 Darkness,  Tarkhan,  Bobby Bennu, 14/1 King's Lynn,  Telemark, 16/1 Mister Bluebird, 20/1 Rhoscolyn,  Sterling Knight,  Afentiko, 25/1 Eldrickjones,  Mirabeau,  Array,  Sword, 33/1 Thunder Roar, 40/1 Nostrum
column32: R A Pegum And P A Henry
column36: Eyecatching form on the continent and he's getting close for current connections
column37: Had quality slow-ground form in Germany and Italy; 0-6 for Jamie Osborne but he's running himself into form, finishing close up behind Great Acclaim at Chepstow and then second from a wide draw at Sandown (7f, soft); no surprise to see him play a part in first-time cheekpieces.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.
column20: 5/1 Native Warrior, 6/1 Akkadian Thunder, 8/1 Leadman, 9/1 Great Acclaim,  Strong Warrior, 12/1 Darkness,  Tarkhan,  Bobby Bennu, 14/1 King's Lynn,  Telemark, 16/1 Mister Bluebird, 20/1 Rhoscolyn,  Sterling Knight,  Afentiko, 25/1 Eldrickjones,  Mirabeau,  Array,  Sword, 33/1 Thunder Roar, 40/1 Nostrum
column36: Figures 112 since the blinkers went on and every chance of being involved once more
column37: The application of blinkers triggered career bests in winning 7f handicaps at Goodwood (good) and Chepstow (good to soft) and another cracking run in defeat behind Darkness back at Goodwood two weeks ago (good to firm); climbing the weights but every chance of being involved once more.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column37: Record of 3-11; won on good to soft but unraced on softer; likely that he'll need more than when second to the veteran King's Lynn at Haydock (7f) and there were no excuses next time at Chester; others are higher up the list.

column36: Could easily leave this season's efforts behind now he returns to slower ground
column37: Not troubled the judge this season but hasn't been running badly, last time behind Native Warrior on the AW in late June; a triple winner on ground softer than good so connections have no doubt been waiting for some rain; worth considering.

column4: Schweppes Handicap

column36: Unlucky not to win at Glorious Goodwood; some doubts about him on soft ground
column37: Third in last season's Britannia on his only previous visit to Ascot; delivered a career best to win at Newcastle (7f) in June when visored for the first time and heaps went wrong when third of 20 as favourite at Glorious Goodwood (good; behind Great Acclaim); has shown he can handle slow ground but questionable whether it's ideal for him.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column36: First past the post in Spring Mile (1m, good to soft) in March; not out of this.
column37: Good effort when fourth to Ebt's Guard over C&D (soft; his only start here) in October; first past the post (demoted due to interference) in the competitive Spring Mile at Doncaster (1m, good to soft) in March; down the field at Newcastle (7f, AW) in May on sole run since but easy turf may be more his thing; not out of this by any stretch.

column27: E A R L Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
column36: Did well to win from off the pace at Goodwood; this softer ground won't faze him
column37: A 7yo with high mileage but did well to win going away from well off the pace at Goodwood a fortnight ago (7f, good to firm), denying the bang-in-form Great Acclaim; hit with a 6lb rise but this softer ground won't faze him and he should run well.

column4: Schweppes Handicap

column36: Excuses for his two no-shows this season; capable but slow ground not absolutely ideal
column37: 5lb well in when eighth in the Clipper Handicap at York (1m, good to firm) but didn't run at all badly from well off the pace; the season had been going well (had excuses at Goodwood); a fast-run 7f suits him but slow ground perhaps less so.

column4: Schweppes Handicap

column36: This is a big drop down from the Commonwealth Cup and he remains unexposed
column37: All four runs on good or quicker ground; relinquished unbeaten record when second on handicap debut at Windsor before flying too high in the Group 1 Commonwealth Cup at Royal Ascot; this is a big drop down from that and he remains unexposed.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column36: Likeable gelding but thoroughly exposed and seventh in this last year off a similar mark
column37: Bombproof gelding who nearly always gives his running but no great surprise at the age of six that he keeps bumping into better-treated opposition; only seventh in this last year off a similar mark.

column4: Schweppes Handicap

column36: Got his season off to a flyer on the AW and some notable efforts in defeat since then
column37: Got his season off to a flyer on the AW and some notable efforts in defeat since then, though Newcastle last time wasn't one of those; he has soft-ground form but may ideally prefer it faster.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column32: The Ffrench Revolution & Mrs T Hamilton
column36: If back to his best on ground he'll enjoy then there's value in his odds
column37: Two soft-ground wins last season included a sales race at York and he also ran well in the Group 3 Horris Hill; signs of retaining plenty of ability in two good-ground Listed races before probably finding a fast surface against him on handicap debut at York; if back to his best on ground he'll enjoy then there's value in his odds.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column36: Has the form to play some role but on a recovery mission after last two efforts
column37: Won twice at two and had deep-ground form; quite an eyecatcher on his comeback in Haydock's Silver Bowl but failed to make an impression in the Britannia and a similar story behind Rhoscolyn at Goodwood (soft); now on a recovery mission.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column36: Running well; has form here, acts on slow ground and Alfie Redman takes off a handy 7lb
column37: Evergreen 8yo who has continued to run well in defeat since snapping a losing run at Haydock in July; has form here, acts on slow ground and Alfie Redman takes off a handy 7lb; can give backers a run for their money.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column36: Hasn't built on his eyecatching third here in the International; will pop up again one day
column37: 4yo with only 14 starts behind him and was a shade unfortunate when third in the C&D International on his only previous run here; a couple of lesser efforts since then reduces the appeal, but he's the type who will pop up one day in a big handicap.

column4: Schweppes Handicap
column19: Wickedly competitive. Back on soft ground and with his 2yo promise not forgotten, a chance is taken on MIRABEAU at lengthy odds.

column27: J P M Main &  Andrew Knott
column36: They've been competitive Racing League handicaps in which he's been holding his own
column37: Very exposed as an eight-time winner and now having his 54th race; however, slow ground holds no fears and they were competitive Racing League handicaps in which he's been holding his own; closely matched with the likes of Great Acclaim and King's Lynn.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column36: On the verge of becoming a tad disappointing, but this is his handicap debut
column37: Won for Sir Michael Stoute at two; highly tried since that maiden win and was gelded prior to finishing third of four in a small-field Listed race at Windsor two weeks ago (extended 1m3f); on the verge of becoming a tad disappointing, but this is his handicap debut and he tries soft ground for the first time.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column36: Stayed on best for winning handicap debut at Goodwood and the form has been franked
column37: Maiden winner who came up shy under penalties but confirmed himself progressive when justifying favouritism in a 1m3f handicap at Glorious Goodwood (good to soft); hit with a 7lb rise but that form has been franked and this colt might well have appreciably more to offer; the one to beat.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column36: Impressed on handicap debut; not disgraced in a muddling Listed race since then
column37: Maiden winner who laughed at his opening mark when scooting home by 4l at Carlisle in June (1m3f, soft; 9lb lower); difficult to gauge what he achieved when last of the seven in a 1m3f good-ground Listed race at Hamilton, going down by under 2l in a slowly run race; remains an unknown quantity.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column32: A Stennett, G Kennington & C Hodgson
column36: Has to be considered after a career best to finish third in the 1m6f Melrose at York
column37: Sole win in six runs came in a Chester maiden but showed his best form yet to finish third in the 1m6f Melrose at York (when 2lb lower) and expect another positive ride back at 1m4f; something to prove on this slower surface but has form claims.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column36: Did well at two on slow ground and hasn't had those conditions this season
column37: Did well as 2yo on ground softer than good; underwhelming this term but on good or quicker ground and could easily stage a revival back under these conditions; blinkers also tried.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column36: Did well to win at the Shergar Cup having pulled hard under an unfamiliar rider
column37: Trainer has won three of the last four runnings of this handicap and is represented by a progressive gelding whose two handicap wins have come over C&D (good; good to firm); only scraped home at the Shergar Cup but did well to win at all having pulled hard under an unfamiliar rider; probably still well handicapped off 4lb higher and Cieren Fallon knows him well; unraced on slow ground.

column4: Silent Pool Gin Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: William Haggas has a terrific record in this handicap and TENABILITY (nap) did well to win at the Shergar Cup after pulling so hard.
column20: 15/8 Push The Limit, 7/2 Rogue Millions,  Tenability, 6/1 Daiquiri Bay, 10/1 Nightwalker,  Topteam, 20/1 Too Soon
column36: Like the winner, he raced keenly when a close fourth to Tenability here last month
column37: All turf runs on good or quicker so conditions are a grey area; interesting, otherwise, having only narrowly relinquished his unbeaten record in handicaps when a close fourth to Tenability at the Shergar Cup (C&D); like the winner, he raced keenly under new handling and could well step up on that form.

column36: Fourth in a Listed last time; not handicapped out of this and goes on soft ground
column37: Another good effort in defeat at Listed level last time, only a week after making a successful handicap debut at Goodwood's big meeting (1m, good; 4lb lower); doesn't look handicapped out of this and she copes with soft ground.

column4: tote UK British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap
column19: Others have achieved a whole lot more but ABLOOM has been progressing steadily away from the bright lights of the big meetings.

column36: Had wind op since forgettable hurdle debut; peak Flat form has to be respected
column37: Reached a smart level on the Flat for the Crisfords (effective at 1m with give underfoot); bitterly disappointing in a novice hurdle on debut for Nicky Henderson but unwise to read too much into that and she's had wind surgery in the meantime.

column36: Listed winner in France but doesn't bring all that much momentum into handicaps
column37: Confined to Listed or Group 3 races for her last seven starts, going 0-5 since scoring on heavy ground at Saint-Cloud last November; doesn't bring all that much momentum into handicaps.

column36: Bought for 150,000gns in July and easily won a Goodwood handicap on stable debut
column37: Bought for 150,000gns after winning a 7f maiden at Chester in May (Abloom back in sixth) on final run for Kevin Ryan; recouped some of that outlay when comfortably taking a 1m Goodwood handicap (good) two weeks ago, albeit at the expense of just four rivals; this demands more off 7lb higher but difficult to weigh up how good she is.

column4: tote UK British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap
column19: Others have achieved a whole lot more but ABLOOM has been progressing steadily away from the bright lights of the big meetings.

column36: Easy novice winner last time and improvers from this yard are a dangerous species
column37: All runs on good or quicker ground but she enters handicaps on the back of a clearcut novice win at Ripon (1m) and improvers from this yard are a dangerous species; interesting.

column4: tote UK British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap
column19: Others have achieved a whole lot more but ABLOOM has been progressing steadily away from the bright lights of the big meetings.
column20: 11/4 Noche Clasica, 3/1 Abloom, 9/2 Protest, 7/1 Miss Tonnerre, 10/1 Treasure, 11/1 Glamis Road,  Asteverdi, 16/1 Twirling,  Bright Times Ahead
column36: Novice winner at two but bitterly disappointing thus far this campaign
column37: Looked promising when justifying favouritism in a Newmarket novice last season (7f, good to soft) but bitterly disappointing thus far this campaign, in a Group 3, a novice and on handicap debut latest.

column4: Racing To School Reaches 250,000 Handicap
column19: Double Rush has more to offer but the return to slow ground can see SERGEANT WILKO display his true colours.
column20: 4/1 Double Rush, 5/1 Binhareer, 8/1 Fast Track Harry, 10/1 Humam,  Brosay, 12/1 Russet Gold,  Jubilee Walk,  Sergeant Wilko, 14/1 Rohaan, 16/1 Fresh,  Badri,  Orazio, 20/1 Candy, 25/1 Arctic Summer,  Carbine Harvester,  King Of Light, 33/1 Coachello,  Jungle Drums,  Twilight Jet
column36: Well suited by both C&D & slow ground; not fired this year but down in weights as a result
column37: Placed in three of his four runs over C&D, notably a good third in a Group 3 (soft) here last October; yet to find his best form in 2025 but he's slipping down the weights, has the assistance of a good apprentice and could benefit from getting back on a slower surface; others still more appealing.

column4: Racing To School Reaches 250,000 Handicap
column19: Double Rush has more to offer but the return to slow ground can see SERGEANT WILKO display his true colours.
column20: 4/1 Double Rush, 5/1 Binhareer, 8/1 Fast Track Harry, 10/1 Humam,  Brosay, 12/1 Russet Gold,  Jubilee Walk,  Sergeant Wilko, 14/1 Rohaan, 16/1 Fresh,  Badri,  Orazio, 20/1 Candy, 25/1 Arctic Summer,  Carbine Harvester,  King Of Light, 33/1 Coachello,  Jungle Drums,  Twilight Jet
column36: Rare blip at York latest; can bounce back but looks a shade high in the weights for now
column37: Had a rare off day at York two weeks ago but he's the type to bounce back quickly and has won at this track in the past; handles soft but wouldn't mind it drying out a bit; not much room for error off this mark though.

column4: Racing To School Reaches 250,000 Handicap
column19: Double Rush has more to offer but the return to slow ground can see SERGEANT WILKO display his true colours.
column20: 4/1 Double Rush, 5/1 Binhareer, 8/1 Fast Track Harry, 10/1 Humam,  Brosay, 12/1 Russet Gold,  Jubilee Walk,  Sergeant Wilko, 14/1 Rohaan, 16/1 Fresh,  Badri,  Orazio, 20/1 Candy, 25/1 Arctic Summer,  Carbine Harvester,  King Of Light, 33/1 Coachello,  Jungle Drums,  Twilight Jet
column36: Not the force of old but did run well on testing ground at Epsom in June; held twice since
column37: Not the force of old (two-time Group 3 winner) but showed a fire still burned when second of 11 at Epsom on Derby day (6f, soft); down the field twice at Goodwood's big meeting and the return to more testing ground isn't enough to tempt.

column4: Racing To School Reaches 250,000 Handicap
column19: Double Rush has more to offer but the return to slow ground can see SERGEANT WILKO display his true colours.
column20: 4/1 Double Rush, 5/1 Binhareer, 8/1 Fast Track Harry, 10/1 Humam,  Brosay, 12/1 Russet Gold,  Jubilee Walk,  Sergeant Wilko, 14/1 Rohaan, 16/1 Fresh,  Badri,  Orazio, 20/1 Candy, 25/1 Arctic Summer,  Carbine Harvester,  King Of Light, 33/1 Coachello,  Jungle Drums,  Twilight Jet
column36: Hasn't delivered what he once promised but conditions will suit and he's feasibly weighted
column37: Looked the proverbial Group horse in a handicap when sauntering to success over C&D in May 2023 on soft ground; more bad days than good since then but flashes last season that he was still a top-notch sprinter on his day, as when third in the Wokingham off a 6lb higher mark than today's; no better than midfield in two feature handicaps this summer but he didn't run too badly at Goodwood and he has too much ability to discount under these conditions.

column4: Racing To School Reaches 250,000 Handicap
column19: Double Rush has more to offer but the return to slow ground can see SERGEANT WILKO display his true colours.
column20: 4/1 Double Rush, 5/1 Binhareer, 8/1 Fast Track Harry, 10/1 Humam,  Brosay, 12/1 Russet Gold,  Jubilee Walk,  Sergeant Wilko, 14/1 Rohaan, 16/1 Fresh,  Badri,  Orazio, 20/1 Candy, 25/1 Arctic Summer,  Carbine Harvester,  King Of Light, 33/1 Coachello,  Jungle Drums,  Twilight Jet
column36: Had excuses at York last time and earlier 2nd at that track was a fine run; ground a worry
column37: Gelded and underwent wind surgery after an unsuccessful stint in Bahrain over the winter; two good runs in 6f handicaps in midsummer, notably his York second in July (6f, good); only eighth back at that track two weeks ago but he stumbled leaving the stalls and then got a bump in the final furlong when still in contention for a place; missed an intended run due to soft ground as a 2yo and could probably do with it drying out.

column4: Racing To School Reaches 250,000 Handicap
